data.title: What happened to Love Actually cast - Daniel Craig romance, bankruptcy, tragic death & rant over 's*** and sexist' film
data.meta_description: WITH a love triangle, an affair and doomed romances - who could have predicted Love Actually would become such an iconic Christmas film?But the festiv
data.text:
WITH a love triangle, an affair and doomed romances - who could have predicted Love Actually would become such an iconic Christmas film?

But the festive flick unites Brits around the country and millions of us gather around our TV screens to watch it every year.

And now, 19 years since Love Actually was released in 2003, some of the cast reunited for a US TV special to reminisce over the iconic film.

Many of its stars, including Keira Knightley, Hugh Grant, Emma Thompson and Colin Firth, already had staggeringly successful careers when they were cast, and have continued to delight audiences.

Here we take a look at the fates of some of its lesser-known cast members...

Thomas Brodie-Sangster

He rose to fame and made a name for himself playing the part of Liam Neeson's lovestruck son Sam, so fans are often shocked to discover the star is now 32.

Since Love Actually Thomas has had a phenomenal career and starred in everything from the Maze Runner series to Game Of Thrones and The Queen's Gambit.

He is reportedly dating Elon Musk's ex-wife Talulah Riley, with the pair making their red carpet debut together earlier this year.

They co-starred in Danny Boyle's Sex Pistols drama Pistol, where he played popstar Malcolm McLaren, and she took on the role of Vivienne Westwood.

Olivia Olson

Olivia stole the show when she smashed Mariah Carey's All I Want for Christmas is You at just 11 years old.

Now the American actress is 30, living in LA, and you may have followed her on The X Factor: Celebrity, where she ended up coming 12th in 2019.

Olivia has also been part of the cast behind the animated series Adventure Time on Cartoon network, where she voices Marceline the Vampire Queen.

She has also worked on Disney's Phineas and Ferb, where she voices Vanessa Doofenshmirtz.

Heike Makatsch

German actress Heike Makatsch became one of the biggest villains of Christmas when her character Mia flirted with her married boss Harry, played by the late Alan Rickman, in the movie.

One of the most emotional scenes saw Harry buy Mia a gold necklace, which his wife, Karen, played by Emma Thompson, thought was for her.

After flirty Mia, Heike played Leisel's mother in the movie version of The Book Thief in 2013.

Heike, 50, has had a string of high-profile romances. She previously dated James Bond star Daniel Craig and was married to actor Max Martin Schröder for 10 years.

She's in a relationship with actor Trystan Pütter and lives in Berlin, and is currently filming in Majorca for German series Der Konig von Palma - which translates to The King of Palma.

Lulu Popplewell

Lulu played Emma Thompson's daughter in Love Actually and famously dressed up as a lobster for her school nativity.

She was 12 years old when she appeared in the beloved Christmas flick but in recent years has branded it "cheesy and sexist".

Speaking on the Almost Famous podcast, Lulu said: "I think it's a s**t film. I think it's aged badly. All the women in it are sort of passive objects."

The 31-year-old, who's now a comedian, was described as unrecognisable by fans of the 2003 film.

Chiwetel Ejiofor

In Love Actually he was Kiera Knightley's doting husband Peter and unknowingly caught in the middle of a love triangle.

While their marriage stayed intact, his best friend Mark, played by Andrew Lincoln, made a questionable attempt to seduce Kiera's character.

Since the 2010 film, Chiwetel took a role in Doctor Strange, starred as Scar in The Lion King remake, and was the lead role of Solomon Northup in 12 Years A Slave.

The latter landed him Best Actor nominations at the Golden Globes, Oscars and a winning nomination at the BAFTAS.

Andrew Lincoln

One of the most memorable scenes from the film sees Andrew's character Mark express his love to Juliet via some cardboard signs outside her house.

Although she famously she ran out and kissed him, she stayed married to his best friend.

Teachers star Andrew's career has boomed since, with a role in AMC series The Walking Dead as sheriff deputy Rick Grimes.

While he didn’t get his fairytale ending in Love Actually, he did in real life.

In June 2006, three years after the heartwarming film was released, he married Gael Anderson. They have two children, Matilda and Arthur.

Joanna Page

Joanna, who played Judy, was one half of the loveably awkward duo that stood in for sex scenes in a porn film, alongside Martin Freeman.

After Love Actually, she went on to appear in everything from Midsomer Murders to Nativity 2: Danger In The Manger and Doctor Who.

But she's best-known for starring as Stacey Shipman in the hit BBC sitcom Gavin & Stacey, which ran from 2007 until 2010. A Christmas special was released in 2019.

Martine McCutcheon

Former EastEnders star Martine was memorable in Love Actually as the cheerful Downing Street staff member who swore at Hugh Grant's Prime Minister, but ended up winning his heart.

Martine has since proved her talents off the screen on the stage, winning an Olivier Award for her role as Eliza in My Fair Lady in the West End.

Martine has also been a panellist on Loose Women, alongside the likes of Katie Price, Andrea McLean, Nadia Swahala and Ruth Langsford.

She has been married to singer Jack McManus since 2012 and has a seven-year-old son, Rafferty.

But she hasn't had an easy time of it, having to file for bankruptcy in 2013, and openly struggling with her health, suffering from Chronic Fatigue Syndrome and Fibromyalgia.

She recently tragically lost her brother at the age of just 31.

Laura Linney

In Love Actually she broke hearts while playing workaholic Sarah, who aside from her busy schedule had to take care of her mentally ill brother.

An outburst from her sibling prematurely ended a saucy moment of passion between Laura's character and her colleague Karl, played by ripped actor Rodrigo Santoro.

Since then she spent a year on the US comedy Frasier, starred in American Dad! and has acted in dark Netflix drama Ozark since 2017.

Despite not sharing any scenes together, Laura and Liam Neeson are close friends in real life and he even walked her down the aisle for her wedding in May 2009.

Rodrigo Santoro

Brazillian actor Rodrigo Santoro's romance with Sarah, played by Laura Linney, sadly came to nothing in the film - but since then he has played a number of big parts.

He was unrecognisable after shaving off his hair to play 'god' Xerxes in the 2006 action flick 300 and also starred as Paulo in Lost.

Recently, Rodrigo played Westworld's 'most wanted' bandit Hector Escaton and starred in Boundless, a drama about two men who sailed around the world 500 years ago.

Lucia Moniz

Lucia played Colin Firth's character Jamie's housekeeper turned love interest, Aurelia - who hilariously spoke no English.

Towards the end of the film Jamie won her heart in a hilariously bumbling scene where the writer tried and often misspoke Portuguese.

Since then Lucia has starred in a number of TV series and films back in Portugal.

January Jones

January played Jeannie, one of the attractive American girls that sex-obsessed Colin (Kris Marshall) bumps into in Wisconsin.

She was the ringleader of the group of girls who fell for his English accent and charms.

A few years later in 2007, she was cast as Betty Draper in Mad Men, which ran until 2015 and is regarded as one of the best television dramas ever made.

The role saw January nominated for two Golden Globe Awards for Best Actress in Television Series Drama and a Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actress in a Drama Series.

Alan Rickman

Alan was already an acting legend when he starred in Love Actually alongside Emma Thompson and Hugh Grant.

He had already taken on the iconic role of Severus Snape in the Harry Potter franchise, and had previously starred in Die Hard, Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves and Sense and Sensibility.

Alan played the character of Harry, a successful director of a design agency, who cheats on his wife Karen with his young, pretty secretary Mia.

He couldn't have been more different from his on-screen love rat character in real life, happily married to former Labour Party councillor Rima Horton after they met in their late teens.

Tragically, Alan passed away after a secret battle with pancreatic cancer in 2016 at the age of 69, having won a Bafta, Emmy, a Golden Globe and a SAG during his glittering career.
